greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Dimension of space of cusp forms of weight 5/2, level 4*n and trivial character.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
H. Cohen and J. Oesterle, Dimensions des espaces de formes modulaires, Modular Functions of One Variable. VI, Proc. 1976 Bonn conf., Lect. Notes in Math. 627, Springer-Verlag, 1977, pp. 69-78.
S. R. Finch, Primitive Cusp Forms, April 27, 2009. [Cached copy, with permission of the author]
mathematica: \[Beta][n_Integer] := Block[{rn}, rn = r[2, n]; Which[rn >= 4, \[Alpha][n], rn === 3, 3, rn === 2 && Or @@ OddQ[(r[#1, n] & ) /@ Select[First /@ FactorInteger[n], Mod[#1, 4] === 3 & ]], 2, True, 3/2]];
s[5/2, #] & /@ Range[4, 240, 4] (* _Wouter Meeussen_, cf. Finch reference, Mar 31 2014 *)
results.author: _Steven Finch_, Apr 17 2009
